meanings.definition: Enter (a party or event) without an invitation.
meanings.sent1: The mischievous boy decided to gatecrash the birthday party next door.
meanings.sent2: She gatecrashed the wedding reception and danced the night away.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel gatecrashed the picnic and stole all the nuts.
meanings.sent4: His loud entrance gatecrashed the peaceful atmosphere of the library.
meanings.sent5: The unexpected storm gatecrashed the outdoor concert, soaking everyone in seconds.

meanings.definition: Attend (a party or event) without being invited.
meanings.sent1: They were surprised to see him gatecrash the movie night without prior notice.
meanings.sent2: She always manages to gatecrash gatherings and make new friends.
meanings.sent3: The cat gatecrashed the dog's playdate and ended up joining in the fun.
meanings.sent4: His infectious laughter gatecrashed the serious meeting, lightening the mood instantly.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of freshly baked cookies gatecrashed the neighborhood, drawing everyone to her door.
